oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Holloway. Gravity railroad, ca. 1923.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: unknown
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Gravity railroad that ran from Bruce Holloway's backyard to the end of their yard (parallel) to Midland, ca. 1923. Flanged wheels came from C.M. McClung Company. The boys in the neighborhood were the maintenance crew. There was a passenger car with a spring at the top, work car.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Railroad cars; Railroads;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Knox County Two Centuries Photograph Project
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number and provide a brief description of the photograph.
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
